Simplified manual. Start here!

Source: R/docs.R
get-started.Rd

You don't need to read long manual pages for a simple task. This manual page collects the most common pak use cases.

Package installation

Install a package from CRAN or Bioconductor

pak::pkg_install("tibble")

pak automatically sets a CRAN repository and the Bioconductor repositories that correspons to the current R version.

Install a package from GitHub

pak::pkg_install("tidyverse/tibble")

#>                                                                         
#> â†’ Will update 2 packages.                                               
#> â†’ All 2 packages (0 B) are cached.                                      
#> + tibble 3.1.8 â†’ 3.1.8.9002 ğŸ‘·ğŸ»ğŸ”§ (GitHub: 37ec86a)                       
#> + vctrs  0.5.1 â†’ 0.5.1.9000 ğŸ‘·ğŸ¾â€â™€ï¸ğŸ”§ (GitHub: 2d7de76)                    
#> â„¹ No downloads are needed, 2 pkgs are cached                            
#> â„¹ Packaging vctrs 0.5.1.9000                                            
#> âœ” Packaged vctrs 0.5.1.9000 (1.4s)                                      
#> â„¹ Building vctrs 0.5.1.9000                                             
#> âœ” Built vctrs 0.5.1.9000 (11.2s)                                        
#> âœ” Installed vctrs 0.5.1.9000 (github::r-lib/vctrs@2d7de76) (34ms)       
#> â„¹ Packaging tibble 3.1.8.9002                                           
#> âœ” Packaged tibble 3.1.8.9002 (502ms)                                    
#> â„¹ Building tibble 3.1.8.9002                                            
#> âœ” Built tibble 3.1.8.9002 (2.7s)                                        
#> âœ” Installed tibble 3.1.8.9002 (github::tidyverse/tibble@37ec86a) (28ms) 
#> âœ” 1 pkg + 10 deps: kept 9, upd 2 [17.5s]

Use the user/repo form. You can specify a branch or tag: user/repo@branch or user/repo@tag.

Install a package from a URL

pak::pkg_install(
  "url::https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/tibble/tibble_3.1.7.tar.gz"
)

#>                                                                         
#> â†’ Will install 1 package.                                               
#> â†’ Will update 1 package.                                                
#> â†’ All 2 packages (38.65 kB) are cached.                                 
#> + ellipsis              0.3.2                                           
#> + tibble   3.1.8.9002 â†’ 3.1.7 ğŸ‘·ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ğŸ”§                                    
#> â„¹ No downloads are needed, 2 pkgs (38.65 kB) are cached                 
#> âœ” Installed ellipsis 0.3.2  (18ms)                                      
#> â„¹ Building tibble 3.1.7                                                 
#> âœ” Built tibble 3.1.7 (2.5s)                                             
#> âœ” Installed tibble 3.1.7  (31ms)                                        
#> âœ” 1 pkg + 11 deps: kept 10, upd 1, added 1 [3.3s]

The URL may point to an R package file, made with R CMD build, or a .tar.gz or .zip archive of a package tree.

Package updates

Update a package

pak::pkg_install("tibble")

#>                                                                         
#> â†’ Will update 1 package.                                                
#> â†’ The package (724.32 kB) is cached.                                    
#> + tibble 3.1.7 â†’ 3.1.8                                                  
#> â„¹ No downloads are needed, 1 pkg (724.32 kB) is cached                  
#> âœ” Installed tibble 3.1.8  (36ms)                                        
#> âœ” 1 pkg + 10 deps: kept 10, upd 1 [368ms]

pak::pkg_install() automatically updates the package.

Update all dependencies of a package

pak::pkg_install("tibble", upgrade = TRUE)

#>                                                                         
#> â„¹ No downloads are needed                                               
#> âœ” 1 pkg + 10 deps: kept 11 [278ms]

update = TRUE updates the package itself and all of its dependencies, if necessary.

Reinstall a package

Add ?reinstall to the package name or package reference in general:

pak::pkg_install("tibble?reinstall")

#>                                                                         
#> â†’ Will install 1 package.                                               
#> â†’ The package (724.32 kB) is cached.                                    
#> + tibble   3.1.8                                                        
#> â„¹ No downloads are needed, 1 pkg (724.32 kB) is cached                  
#> âœ” Installed tibble 3.1.8  (60ms)                                        
#> âœ” 1 pkg + 10 deps: kept 10, added 1 [340ms]

Dependency lookup

Dependencies of a CRAN or Bioconductor package

pak::pkg_deps("tibble")

#> # A data frame: 11 Ã— 32                                                 
#>    ref       type  direct direcâ€¦Â¹ status package version license needsâ€¦Â²
#>    <chr>     <chr> <lgl>  <lgl>   <chr>  <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <lgl>  
#>  1 cli       stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     cli     3.4.1   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#>  2 fansi     stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     fansi   1.0.3   GPL-2 â€¦ FALSE  
#>  3 glue      stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     glue    1.6.2   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#>  4 lifecycle stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     lifecyâ€¦ 1.0.3   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#>  5 magrittr  stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     magritâ€¦ 2.0.3   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#>  6 pillar    stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     pillar  1.8.1   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#>  7 pkgconfig stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     pkgconâ€¦ 2.0.3   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#>  8 rlang     stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     rlang   1.0.6   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#>  9 tibble    stanâ€¦ TRUE   TRUE    OK     tibble  3.1.8   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#> 10 utf8      stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     utf8    1.2.2   Apacheâ€¦ FALSE  
#> 11 vctrs     stanâ€¦ FALSE  FALSE   OK     vctrs   0.5.1   MIT + â€¦ FALSE  
#> # â€¦ with 23 more variables: priority <chr>, md5sum <chr>, sha256 <chr>, 
#> #   filesize <int>, built <chr>, platform <chr>, rversion <chr>,        
#> #   repotype <chr>, repodir <chr>, target <chr>, deps <list>,           
#> #   mirror <chr>, sources <list>, remote <list>, error <list>,          
#> #   metadata <list>, dep_types <list>, params <list>, sysreqs <chr>,    
#> #   cache_status <chr>, lib_status <chr>, old_version <chr>,            
#> #   new_version <chr>, and abbreviated variable names Â¹â€‹directpkg, â€¦

The results are returned in a data frame.

Dependency tree of a CRAN / Bioconductor package

pak::pkg_deps_tree("tibble")

#> tibble 3.1.8 âœ¨                                                          
#> â”œâ”€fansi 1.0.3 âœ¨                                                         
#> â”œâ”€lifecycle 1.0.3 âœ¨                                                     
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€cli 3.4.1 âœ¨                                                         
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€glue 1.6.2 âœ¨                                                        
#> â”‚ â””â”€rlang 1.0.6 âœ¨                                                       
#> â”œâ”€magrittr 2.0.3 âœ¨                                                      
#> â”œâ”€pillar 1.8.1 âœ¨                                                        
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€cli                                                                 
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€fansi                                                               
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€glue                                                                
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€lifecycle                                                           
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€rlang                                                               
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€utf8 1.2.2 âœ¨                                                        
#> â”‚ â””â”€vctrs 0.5.1 âœ¨                                                       
#> â”‚   â”œâ”€cli                                                               
#> â”‚   â”œâ”€glue                                                              
#> â”‚   â”œâ”€lifecycle                                                         
#> â”‚   â””â”€rlang                                                             
#> â”œâ”€pkgconfig 2.0.3 âœ¨                                                     
#> â”œâ”€rlang                                                                 
#> â””â”€vctrs                                                                 
#>                                                                         
#> Key:  âœ¨ new

The results are also silently returned in a data frame.

Dependency tree of a package on GitHub

pak::pkg_deps_tree("tidyverse/tibble")

#> tidyverse/tibble 3.1.8.9002 âœ¨ğŸ‘·ğŸ¼ğŸ”§                                        
#> â”œâ”€fansi 1.0.3 âœ¨                                                         
#> â”œâ”€lifecycle 1.0.3 âœ¨                                                     
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€cli 3.4.1 âœ¨                                                         
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€glue 1.6.2 âœ¨                                                        
#> â”‚ â””â”€rlang 1.0.6 âœ¨

#> â”œâ”€pillar 1.8.1 âœ¨

#> â”‚ â”œâ”€fansi                                                               
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€glue                                                                
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€lifecycle                                                           
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€rlang                                                               
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€utf8 1.2.2 âœ¨

#> â”‚   â”œâ”€glue

#> â”‚   â””â”€rlang                                                             
#> â”œâ”€pkgconfig 2.0.3 âœ¨                                                     
#> â”œâ”€rlang                                                                 
#> â””â”€r-lib/vctrs                                                           
#>                                                                         
#> Key:  âœ¨ new | ğŸ‘·ğŸ¼ build | ğŸ”§ compile

Use the user/repo form. As usual, you can also select a branch, tag, or sha, with the user/repo@branch, user/repo@tag or user/repo@sha forms.

Dependency tree of the package in the current directory

pak::local_deps_tree("tibble")

#> local::tibble 3.1.8 âœ¨ğŸ‘·ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ğŸ”§                                             
#> â”œâ”€fansi 1.0.3 âœ¨                                                         
#> â”œâ”€lifecycle 1.0.3 âœ¨                                                     
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€cli 3.4.1 âœ¨                                                         
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€glue 1.6.2 âœ¨                                                        
#> â”‚ â””â”€rlang 1.0.6 âœ¨                                                       
#> â”œâ”€magrittr 2.0.3 âœ¨                                                      
#> â”œâ”€pillar 1.8.1 âœ¨                                                        
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€cli                                                                 
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€fansi                                                               
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€glue                                                                
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€lifecycle                                                           
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€rlang                                                               
#> â”‚ â”œâ”€utf8 1.2.2 âœ¨                                                        
#> â”‚ â””â”€vctrs 0.5.1 âœ¨                                                       
#> â”‚   â”œâ”€cli                                                               
#> â”‚   â”œâ”€glue                                                              
#> â”‚   â”œâ”€lifecycle                                                         
#> â”‚   â””â”€rlang                                                             
#> â”œâ”€pkgconfig 2.0.3 âœ¨                                                     
#> â”œâ”€rlang                                                                 
#> â””â”€vctrs                                                                 
#>                                                                         
#> Key:  âœ¨ new | ğŸ‘·ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ build | ğŸ”§ compile

Assuming package is in directory tibble.

Explain a recursive dependency

How does tibble depend on rlang?

pak::pkg_deps_explain("tibble", "rlang")

#> tibble -> lifecycle -> rlang                                            
#> tibble -> pillar -> lifecycle -> rlang                                  
#> tibble -> pillar -> rlang                                               
#> tibble -> pillar -> vctrs -> lifecycle -> rlang                         
#> tibble -> pillar -> vctrs -> rlang                                      
#> tibble -> rlang                                                         
#> tibble -> vctrs -> lifecycle -> rlang                                   
#> tibble -> vctrs -> rlang

Use can also use the user/repo form for packages from GitHub, url::... for packages at URLs, etc.

Package development

Install dependencies of local package

pak::local_install_deps()

#> âœ” Loading metadata database ... done                                    
#>                                                                         
#> â†’ The package (0 B) is cached.                                          
#> â„¹ No downloads are needed                                               
#> âœ” 10 deps: kept 10 [3.2s]

Install local package

pak::local_install()

#>                                                                         
#> â†’ Will update 1 package.                                                
#> â†’ The package (0 B) is cached.                                          
#> + tibble 3.1.8 â†’ 3.1.8 ğŸ‘·ğŸ»â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ”§                                           
#> â„¹ No downloads are needed, 1 pkg is cached                              
#> âœ” Got tibble 3.1.8 (source) (96 B)                                      
#> â„¹ Packaging tibble 3.1.8                                                
#> âœ” Packaged tibble 3.1.8 (864ms)                                         
#> â„¹ Building tibble 3.1.8                                                 
#> âœ” Built tibble 3.1.8 (2.4s)                                             
#> âœ” Installed tibble 3.1.8 (local) (38ms)                                 
#> âœ” 1 pkg + 10 deps: kept 10, upd 1, dld 1 (NA B) [4.2s]

Install all dependencies of local package

#> âœ” Installed nlme 3.1-161  (33ms)                                        
#> âœ” Built htmlwidgets 1.6.0 (1.1s)                                        
#> âœ” Installed htmlwidgets 1.6.0  (22ms)                                   
#> âœ” 103 deps: kept 15, upd 2, added 86 [10.2s]

Installs development and optional dependencies as well.

Repositories

List current repositories

pak::repo_get()

#> # A data frame: 5 Ã— 5                                                   
#>   name          url                                type  r_verâ€¦Â¹ bioc_â€¦Â²
#> * <chr>         <chr>                              <chr> <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 CRAN          https://cloud.r-project.org        cran  *       NA     
#> 2 BioCsoft      https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 3 BioCann       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 4 BioCexp       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 5 BioCworkflows https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> # â€¦ with abbreviated variable names Â¹â€‹r_version, Â²â€‹bioc_version

If you haven't set a CRAN or Bioconductor repository, pak does that automatically.

Add custom repository

pak::repo_add(rhub = 'https://r-hub.r-universe.dev')
pak::repo_get()

#> # A data frame: 6 Ã— 5                                                   
#>   name          url                                type  r_verâ€¦Â¹ bioc_â€¦Â²
#> * <chr>         <chr>                              <chr> <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 CRAN          https://cloud.r-project.org        cran  *       NA     
#> 2 rhub          https://r-hub.r-universe.dev       cranâ€¦ *       NA     
#> 3 BioCsoft      https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 4 BioCann       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 5 BioCexp       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 6 BioCworkflows https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> # â€¦ with abbreviated variable names Â¹â€‹r_version, Â²â€‹bioc_version

Remove custom repositories

options(repos = getOption("repos")["CRAN"])
pak::repo_get()

#> # A data frame: 5 Ã— 5                                                   
#>   name          url                                type  r_verâ€¦Â¹ bioc_â€¦Â²
#> * <chr>         <chr>                              <chr> <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 CRAN          https://cloud.r-project.org        cran  *       NA     
#> 2 BioCsoft      https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 3 BioCann       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 4 BioCexp       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 5 BioCworkflows https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> # â€¦ with abbreviated variable names Â¹â€‹r_version, Â²â€‹bioc_version

If you set the repos option to a CRAN repo only, or unset it completely, then pak keeps only CRAN and (by default) Bioconductor.

Time travel using RSPM

pak::repo_add(CRAN = "RSPM@2022-06-30")
pak::repo_get()

#> # A data frame: 5 Ã— 5                                                   
#>   name          url                                type  r_verâ€¦Â¹ bioc_â€¦Â²
#> * <chr>         <chr>                              <chr> <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 CRAN          https://packagemanager.posit.co/câ€¦ cran  *       NA     
#> 2 BioCsoft      https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 3 BioCann       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 4 BioCexp       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 5 BioCworkflows https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> # â€¦ with abbreviated variable names Â¹â€‹r_version, Â²â€‹bioc_version

Sets a repository that is equivalent to CRAN's state closest to the specified date. Name this repository CRAN, otherwise pak will also add a default CRAN repository.

Time travel using MRAN

pak::repo_add(CRAN = "MRAN@2022-06-30")
pak::repo_get()

#> # A data frame: 5 Ã— 5                                                   
#>   name          url                                type  r_verâ€¦Â¹ bioc_â€¦Â²
#> * <chr>         <chr>                              <chr> <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 CRAN          https://cran.microsoft.com/snapshâ€¦ cran  *       NA     
#> 2 BioCsoft      https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 3 BioCann       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 4 BioCexp       https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> 5 BioCworkflows https://bioconductor.org/packagesâ€¦ bioc  4.2.2   3.16   
#> # â€¦ with abbreviated variable names Â¹â€‹r_version, Â²â€‹bioc_version

Sets a repository that is equivalent to CRAN's state at the specified date. Name this repository CRAN, otherwise pak will also add a default CRAN repository.

Caches

By default pak caches both metadata and downloaded packages.

Inspect metadata cache

pak::meta_list()

#> âœ” Updated metadata database: 4.55 MB in 4 files.                        
#> âœ” Updating metadata database ... done                                   
#> # A data frame: 43,718 Ã— 32                                             
#>    package version depends suggeâ€¦Â¹ license imports linkiâ€¦Â² archs enhanâ€¦Â³

Update metadata cache

By default pkg_install() and similar functions automatically update the metadata for the currently set repositories if it is older than 24 hours. You can also force an update manually:

pak::meta_update()

#> âœ” Updating metadata database ... done

Clean metadata cache

pak::meta_clean(force = TRUE)
pak::meta_summary()

#> [1] "/Users/gaborcsardi/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/pkgcache/_metad
#> ata"                                                                    
#>                                                                         
#> $current_db                                                             
#> [1] "/Users/gaborcsardi/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/pkgcache/_metad
#> ata/pkgs-d1c324e625.rds"                                                
#>                                                                         
#> $raw_files                                                              
#> character(0)                                                            
#>                                                                         
#> $db_files                                                               
#> character(0)                                                            
#>                                                                         
#> $size                                                                   
#> [1] 0                                                                   
#>

Clean package cache

pak::cache_clean()
